citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
The registrant was unable to provide a written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) or proof that the AV is employed under
formal arrangements. The Attending Veterinarian (AV) is not a full time employee of this facility. Without a PVC, it is not
possible to evaluate the adequacy of care of the animal according to the direction of the AV. The research facility must
employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian or
consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly
scheduled visits to the research facility. To be corrected by 1 September 2023.

The registrant was unable to provide minutes of IACUC meetings from the last two sessions (July 2023 and January
2023). Lack of documentation of meeting minutes prevents evaluation of compliance of IACUC functions. The research
facility must maintain records of minutes of IACUC meetings, including records of attendance, activities of the Committee,
and Committee deliberations. To be corrected 5 Sept 2023 and with all future IACUC meetings.

The registrant was unable to provide records of semiannual reports for the last year. These reports allow the research
facility to evaluate and respond to deficiencies in the IACUC functions and in the facility. These reports also inform the
Institutional Official of the facility's compliance with the Animal Welfare Act. The research facility must maintain records of
semiannual IACUC reports and recommendations (including minority views), prepared in accordance with the
requirements of § 2.31(c)(3) of this subpart, and forwarded to the Institutional Official. To be corrected by 5 Sept 2023 and
with all future semiannual reports.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the registrant.
